text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
CaseReport Case Report
identifier Σ0..*IdentifierBusiness Identifier for event
definition Σ0..*Reference(ActivityDefinition)Instantiates protocol or definition
partOf Σ0..*Reference(Any)Part of referenced event
status ?!Σ1..1codein-progress | suspended | aborted | completed | entered-in-error | unknown
Binding: EventStatus (required)
code Σ0..*CodeableConceptCase Report Code
Binding: Case Report Codes (preferred)
subject Σ1..1Reference(Patient), Reference(Group)The Patient
context Σ0..1Reference(Encounter), Reference(EpisodeOfCare)Encounter / Episode associated with event
effective[x] Σ1..1dateTime, Period, TimingWhen event occurred
date Σ0..1dateTimeDate of the Report
performer Σ0..1Responsible Provider
role Σ0..1CodeableConceptWhat type of performance was done
Binding: Procedure Performer Role Codes (example)
actor Σ1..1Reference(Practitioner), Reference(PractitionerRole), Reference(Organization), Reference(Patient), Reference(Device), Reference(RelatedPerson)Individual who was performing
facility 0..1Reference(Organization)The facility sending the CR
occupationCode Σ0..*CodeableConceptOccupation
Binding: (unbound) (required)
occupationReference Σ0..*Reference(Observation)Occupation
pregnancyCode Σ0..1CodeableConceptPregnancy Status Code
Binding: v2 Yes/no Indicator (required)
pregnancyReference Σ0..1Reference(Condition), Reference(Observation)Pregnancy Status Reference
travelHistory Σ0..*BackboneElementTravel History
date Σ0..1PeriodTravel History Dates
locationCode Σ0..1CodeableConceptTravel History Location - Coded
Binding: Jurisdiction ValueSet (example)
locationReference Σ0..1Reference(Case Report Travel Location Profile)Travel History Location - Address
clinicalFindings Σ1..*BackboneElementClinical findings
code Σ0..1CodeableConceptFinding codes
Binding: Condition/Problem/Diagnosis Codes (example)
reference Σ0..1Reference(DiagnosticReport), Reference(Observation), Reference(Condition), Reference(QuestionnaireResponse), Reference(MedicationStatement)Finding references
description Σ0..1stringFinding free text
isReason Σ0..1booleanFinbdings trigger flag
treatments 0..*Reference(ProcedureRequest), Reference(MedicationRequest), Reference(MedicationStatement)Treatments
note 0..*AnnotationComments made about the case

Documentation for this format

element.definition: For use in reporting suspected conditions from provider to public (population) health departments.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.definition: Identifiers assigned to this event performer or other systems.
element.requirements: Allows identification of the event as it is known by various participating systems and in a way that remains consistent across servers.

element.definition: A protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that was adhered to in whole or in part by this event.
element.comment: [The allowed reference resources may be adjusted as appropriate for the event resource].

element.definition: A larger event of which this particular event is a component or step.
element.comment: Not to be used to link an event to an Encounter - use Event.context for that.
element.requirements: E.g. Drug administration as part of a procedure, procedure as part of observation, etc.

element.short: in-progress | suspended | aborted | completed | entered-in-error | unknown
element.definition: The current state of the event.
element.comment:
A nominal state-transition diagram can be found in the [[event.html#statemachine | Event pattern]] documentation

Unknown does not represent "other" - one of the defined statuses must apply.  Unknown is used when the authoring system is not sure what the current status is.

binding.description: Codes identifying the stage lifecycle stage of a event

element.definition: Reportable condition codes that caused this report to be generated.

binding.description: Codes indicating what triggered this case report.  Based upon Lab Order Code, Lab Result Code, Lab Results and Diagnosis.

element.definition: The individual or set of individuals the case report is about.
element.comment: [For resources that aren't patient-specific, the set of allowed resources may be extended to include other things.  Group should generally be retained unless there's certainty this resource won't be used for veterinary, research or public health settings where Group may be necessary (e.g. this cage of rats/crate of chickens, group of people in a 5 mile radious of the incident, etc.)].
element.requirements: Links the event to the Patient context.

mapping.map: PAT in proximity to EVN segment

element.definition: The encounter or episode of care that establishes the context for this event.
element.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some events may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter or episode but still be tied to the context of the encounter or episode (e.g. pre-admission lab tests).
element.requirements: Links the request to the Encounter context.

mapping.map: PV1 in proximity to EVN segment

element.definition: Date and time of the provider's most recent encounter with the patient regarding the reportable condition.
element.comment: [The list of types may be constrained as appropriate for the type of event].

element.definition: The date on which the reporting party completed the report.
The Provider responsible for Paitent's care.
element.comment: [Resources may choose to replace this with just a single performer or repeating where there's no need to distinguish role and/or responsible organization].

element.short: What type of performance was done
element.definition: Describes the type of performance (e.g. primary surgeon, anaesthesiologiest, etc.).
element.comment: [Adjust vocabulary to be appropriate to your domain - generally should reflect what the performer does, not who they are].

binding.description: Codes describing the types of functional roles performers can take on when performing events

element.definition: The device, practitioner, etc. who performed the action.
The organization whrer the case originated.
element.requirements: Practitioners and Devices can be associated with multiple organizations.  This element indicates which organization they were acting on behalf of when performing the action.

element.definition: The patient's occupation.
element.requirements: Identification of potential risk,  transmission risk.

binding.description: US Department of Labor Bureau of Labor Statitics Occupational Group Codes

element.definition: The patient's occupation.
element.requirements: Identification of potential risk,  transmission risk.

element.definition: The patient's coded pregnancy status.
element.requirements: Appropriate treatment, follow-up,  appropriate for scoring/risk  ascertainment.

element.definition: The patient's pregnancy status.
element.requirements: Appropriate treatment, follow-up,  appropriate for scoring/risk  ascertainment.

element.definition: The patient's travel history including dates and location.
element.requirements: Risk, potential severity of action,  timeliness of action (e.g. is travel  history relevant); Prioritization and triaging.

element.definition: The period during which the patient's traveled.
Where the patient traveled to as a coded concept or free text.

binding.description: Where the patient traveled to as a coded concept. This value set is based upon ISO 3166 (Countries) as well as FIPS 5-2 (States).

element.definition: Where the patient traveled to as an address.
This order triggered this case report to be generated.

Specific text, code or reference for finding or diagnosis, which may include ruled-out or resolved conditions, history, signs and symptoms, diagnostic information and provider interpretations and diagnoses.
element.requirements: Indicators of reportable condition -Important descriptors of condition/ epidemiologic information that support epidemiologic investigation.

mapping.map: Lab Result, Symptoms, Diagnosis, HPI, Reason for Visit

element.definition: Coded diagnosis or symptoms or other findiings relevant to the case.

binding.description: Codes identifying the findings for this case

mapping.map: Lab Result, Symptoms, Diagnosis, HPI, Reason for VisitLab Result, Symptoms, Diagnosis, HPI, Reason for Visit

element.definition: Resource references for patient findings that are relevnat to the case.

mapping.map: Lab Result, Symptoms, Diagnosis, HPI, Reason for VisitLab Result, Symptoms, Diagnosis, HPI, Reason for Visit

element.definition: Finding and diagnosis in  free text only format.
element.comment: This can be used for provider’s narrative of the history of the reportable event.

mapping.map: Lab Result, Symptoms, Diagnosis, HPI, Reason for VisitLab Result, Symptoms, Diagnosis, HPI, Reason for Visit

element.definition: This finding triggered thiscase report to be generated.
Treatments for the reportable event.
element.requirements: To find treatments that were  prescribed; prophylaxis; knowing if the  patient has already been treated, lower  on the list for PH (priority).

element.definition: Comments made about the event by the performer, subject or other participants.
For use in reporting suspected conditions from provider to public (population) health departments.

element.requirements: Allows identification of the event as it is known by various participating systems and in a way that remains consistent across servers.
